pages.text: Beishanichthys brevicaudalis is a species of early Triassic Actinopterygian from China. Able to grow up to 70 cm in length, this fish possessed a long and fusiform body with a characteristically long dorsal fin ending almost at the beginning of the fan shaped tail.

The large orbits and body, alongside the other characteristics of its anatomy, suggest it was a large predator in his waters, feeding on smaller bony fishes, one that probably was quite rare in its native environment.
The species was first described in 2011 from fossil remains found on Beishan hill in the Gansu province of China, in early Triassic lacustrine sediments.
